column33: seeing a lower active percentage creates "guilt", and therefore "forces" me to focus (in a non-overwhelming way)

column31: The focus chart, focus timeline and the code history, as they show evidence of my thinking throughout the exercise and show which obstacles I faced when solving it.
column32: Make things occupy less space, it is easy to get overwhelmed with statistics and metrics. Present a more hierarchical view where the elements that are shown up-front are those that are the most important, only then query the user for extra details. For example, there are plenty of metrics at the right of the sessions overview that I found overwhelming, I had to spend some time digesting the information to understand what I was looking at.
column33: I could see the problems I faced when developing my solutions (e.g. did not know C++ constructor syntax and how to pass objects). This means I can then strive to fix those problems, and learn more about subjects I had more difficulty in.
column34: I am not sure if the platform already tracks it (through the "Menu" focus category for instance), but I think it would be useful to know how much time we spend in waiting for our code to run and see its results, i.e. the feedback loop. If we spend too much time in this loop, we might come to conclusions about how we are spending our time, such as insecurity in our solution or pretending to be productive.

column32: Introducing tips explaining about each of the metrics, what it is, how it can be interpreted, etc.
column33: I could see the score evolution for all my attempts.

column32:
Display an "empty view" to components where there is no data to be presented. For instance, when clicking on "View assessment details" in the "History" page and there is no output to be presented, show a message indicating that no output was produced.

Furthermore, I would reduce the number of columns from 1 to 2 in the "History" page, concerning the assessments. One assessment per row would look less complex. About the assessments, I would also add a filter to search assessments by challenge, level, order by date, score and completion, for example.
column33: By having a calendar with my submissions, I can analyse my consistency over the months.
column34: If I were to add something, it would be a count with the successful submissions per day.
